column1: #   In case of problem, please report to:
#Title: Definitions and examples of light curve classes
S|Smooth; power-law decline with no major fluctuations                                                  |CP Lac, V1668 Cyg, V2275 Cyg
P|Plateau; smooth decline interrupted by a long-lasting nearly flat interval followed by steeper decline|V4633 Sgr, CP Pup, RS Oph
D|Dust dip; decline interrupted by fast decline, minimum, and recovery to just below original decline   |DQ Her, FH Ser, V705 Cas
C|Cusp; power-law decline plus secondary maximum with steepening rise then steep decline                |V2362 Cyg, V1493 Aql, V2491 Cyg
O|Oscillations; smooth decline with interval showing quasi-sinusoidal variations                        |V603 Aql, GK Per, V1494 Aql
F|Flat topped; smooth light curve with an extended interval at the peak with near constant brightness   |DO Aql, V849 Oph, BT Mon
J|Jitter; decline displays substantial variability often as short-duration brightenings                 |DK Lac, HR Del, V723 Cas
